markers.title: Birkenhead River - Lower
markers.class: III(+), IV if doing the first rapids

markers.title: Birkenhead River - Upper
markers.class: IV-V at medium, V at medium-high and up.

markers.title: Blaeberry River - Split Creek to Thompson Falls
Bobbie Burns Creek into Spillimacheen River
Bowser River
markers.class: II-III with one long IV+ rapid

markers.title: Bridge River - Terzaghi Dam to Yalakom
Cariboo River - Lower Run
markers.class: II to III (III+ at high water)

markers.title: Cariboo River - Upper Run
markers.class: III+ to IV- (IV in high water)

markers.title: Cheakamus River - Balls To The Wall
Cheakamus River - Upper
markers.class: IV at 2.5, continuous.  Gets harder as levels rise.

markers.title: Chilliwack Canyon - Camp Foley to Slesse
markers.class: III-IV low, IV- medium, IV high

markers.title: Chilliwack River - Pointa Vista to Vedder Bridge
Chilliwack River – Post Creek to Camp Foley
Chilliwack River - Tamihi to Pointa Vista
Cowichan River - Skutz Falls to Marie Canyon
Foley Creek
markers.class: III(+) with potential IV moves with wood.

markers.title: Fraser River – Alexandra Bridge to Yale
markers.class: : Two III-IV drops (difficult to portage) and lots of flatwater.

markers.title: Gun Creek
markers.class: III-IV.  Slightly stressful because of wood, and a lack of good eddies.

markers.title: Kicking Horse - Palliser to Kicking Horse Rest Area
Kicking Horse River - Kicking Horse Rest Area to Lower Canyon
Kicking Horse River - Lower Canyon to Downtown Golden
Kicking Horse - Yoho Park Boundary to Palliser
Kitsumkalum (Kalum) River
markers.class: III+ to IV.  Pushy at high water - a swim would be unpleasant.

markers.title: Lens Creek
markers.class: IV-V at low to medium flows

markers.title: Lynn Creek
markers.class: III at low levels, IV when the water is high.

markers.title: Moyeha River
markers.class: Scenic I-III packrafting, or manky IV-V creeking

markers.title: Nahatlach River – Francis Lake to Apocynum Campground
Norrish Creek
markers.class: IV-IV+ at medium levels.  Mainly class III-IV but one unportagable rapid is tricky and dangerous.

markers.title: Pingston - Middle
markers.class: IV with a short V section at the end

markers.title: Quesnel River
markers.class: III+ to IV- (IV at High water)

markers.title: Rutherford Creek
markers.class: Continuous class IV-V, class V at higher levels.

markers.title: Ryan River - Lower
markers.class: Continuous class IV-V. Class V at high flows.

markers.title: Seymour River Canyon
markers.class: Highly level dependent - ranges from fun class IV to raging class V.

markers.title: Silverhope Creek
markers.class: IV-IV+ to V, depending on the put in and take out used.

markers.title: Slesse Creek
markers.class: III with a short IV- canyon

markers.title: Soo River
markers.class: IV at medium levels, somewhat continuous.  Tolerates high water very well, but becomes class V.

markers.title: Squamish River - Upper
markers.class: III-IV boating through some significant canyons.

markers.title: Toby Creek - 7 Canyons
markers.class: Mostly class IV/IV+ with one definite class V that can be portaged

markers.title: Trent River
markers.class: V for the waterfall; III for the paddle out

markers.title: Tutshi River
markers.class: III-IV at low water, IV-V at high water

markers.title: Upper Callaghan
markers.class: III+ with one IV- easy waterfall

markers.title: Upper Soo
markers.class: III (with a major portage, and quite a bit of flat water)
